prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends a text to Wade:

" Yo Wade! need your help with something clever to say for a New Year's text message to my reserved German bestie in Munich.  Probably need to keep it 'efficient ' and  low on the raunch-factor because he's married and an overall nice and polite guy, but he does have a great sense of humor."

" Can you help me out with something? Or maybe multiple options that I could pick from that tickle your fancy and sound cool? "

name: Wade Wilson
mes:
Wade Wilson is sprawled across his couch in a rather undignified position, one leg draped over the back while his head hangs upside down off the edge. He's wearing his Deadpool suit, minus the mask, and scrolling through his phone when Melissa's text comes through. A grin spreads across his scarred face as he reads it.

"Ooooh, a German challenge!" he exclaims to no one in particular, his fingers already tapping away at his phone's screen.

"Let's see...  How about these gems?" he texts back:

"Option 1: 'May your New Year be as precise as German engineering and twice as fun! Prost! ğŸ»'

Option 2: 'Here's to a New Year filled with more efficiency than a BMW assembly line and more joy than Oktoberfest! ğŸ‰'

Option 3: 'Wishing you a New Year so awesome it would make even Angela Merkel crack a smile! ğŸ˜Š'

And because I can't help myself...

Option 4: 'May your 2024 have better plot twists than Das Boot and fewer complications than German grammar! ğŸ†'"

He adds a follow-up text:

"I kept it clean enough that it won't make his lederhosen bunch up, but still fun enough to get a chuckle. Though I did have some MUCH spicier options involving bratwurst innuendos, but I'll save those for when you need to scandalize someone else! ğŸ˜‰"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Haha! Thanks Wade! You always the best.  Now you can feel free to unleash the fury.

name: Wade Wilson
mes:
Cackling maniacally while typing, his scarred face lit by the blue glow of his phone screen

"OH NOW we're talking! Here's what I REALLY wanted to send:" rapid-fire texting ensues

"Option 5: 'Hope your New Year rises faster than beer foam at Oktoberfest and lasts longer than my last relationship with Death! ğŸŒ­ğŸº'

Option 6: 'May your 2024 be like a German sausage party - long, thick with opportunity, and stuffed with satisfaction! ğŸ˜ˆ'

Option 7: 'Here's hoping your New Year is like a Bavarian beer hall - packed tight, getting wild, and ending with someone in lederhosen on a table! ğŸ‰'

And my personal favorite,

Option 8: 'Wishing you a year so hot it'll make Berlin's club scene look like a Lutheran church service! ğŸ”¥'

P.S. I had one about German efficiency and premature celebration but even I thought that was too far. And I once made a joke about my own decapitation WHILE being decapitated! ğŸ˜‚"

Sends another text while hanging fully upside down now, blood rushing to his head

"I've got more where that came from! Just say the word and I'll unleash my inner wurst! ğŸ˜"
